subject: Travel
title: Petra: Carved from Living Rock
description: A micro-lesson that makes Petra: Carved from Living Rock usable.

hook.text: Hidden in a narrow canyon in Jordan, an ancient city is carved directly into pink sandstone.

buildup.text: The Nabataeans built Petra around 300 BC as a trading hub between Arabia, Egypt, and Rome.

discovery.text: Its Treasury facade stands 130 feet tall, cut into the cliff face with incredible precision.

twist.text: Petra was lost to the Western world for centuries until a Swiss explorer rediscovered it in 1812.

climax.text: Only 15% of the city has been excavated. Most of Petra still lies buried underground.

punchline.text: The rose-red city is still revealing its secrets.

quiz.question: How much of Petra has been excavated?
